website_summaries.verdict: HP's basic Deskjet D2660 inkjet has a fold-up paper tray and a unique paper corral that make it easy to store away. We noticed several flaws in the output quality, but if you don't expect too much in terms of photo output, this $50 inkjet will make an excellent at-home printer for intermittent use.

customer_reviews.title: Need to reinstall it very often
customer_reviews.text: Bought this purely because of it's size, if my daughter had more space in her student accommodation I would have chosen a three in one printer. I have owned different HP printers still do, but this one is absolutely wrong. Gives errors constantly, not recognizing genuine cartridges when they are not newly installed, printer needs to be reinstalled when failing. I would definitely not recommend this specific model, Got my other daughter one too, she has the same problems, the only showed up later
customer_reviews.author: Robja

customer_reviews.title: dreadful software & noise
customer_reviews.text: This printer loaded some obstructive programs on my computer which hog 99% of the CPU and bring the household wi-fi network to its knees. Had to take the programs off of the start-up menu which finally seems to have solved the problem. No idea what those programs were for. This printer also does not start automatically when you click the print button, an annoyance. It is incredibly noisy.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just awful
customer_reviews.text: It must be said up front - I come from an HP family (Mom worked for the printer/imaging division for 20-something years). That said, I have seen more than my fair share of HP hardware and have been a fan (really, I would have switched if the product sucked.) That said, I can only say it straight up - This printer is awful. The software is terrible and intrusive. Paper feeding is iffy at best. Front panel control are unhelpful. Really, there's no cost savings here. Spend more on a better printer and you'll save the differnce in time and headache.
customer_reviews.author: T. Graves

customer_reviews.title: Gem
customer_reviews.text: I am delighted with the HP 2660. It has a smaller footprint on my desk than my previous printer and is much, much quieter. It installed very easily (I am not tech savvy) and went to work right away. The print quality is fine. It's a tad slow but that's not a major problem for me.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Its Great!
customer_reviews.text: Believe it or not, I am really impressed with this item and I never thought that I would use it as often as I do. It is great for when you need a quick few copies. I've noticed that I am oftentimes in need of just three or four copies, instead of a dozen or more. This little baby sits right on my desk and has eliminated my frequent trips to the copier....it's a must have item.
customer_reviews.author: M. V. McElroy

customer_reviews.title: Avoid buying this at all costs.
customer_reviews.text: I have never written a review on anything, but this is so bad people should be aware of it. I have always bought HP's and never had an issue until this piece of junk. It has issues with its on/off button. I have to unplug it if I want it to turn off. While annoying, it's not nearly as bad as the fact that it only works on occassion. It often just freezes up my computer. I would rather handwrite out whatever I'm printing than ever use this printer again.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: It's a printer
customer_reviews.text: It's loud, it sometimes won't print unless you restart your computer, and mine started printing wavy lines after about 6 months of occasional use. It's a printer. Don't expect it to be anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Meghin Otillia

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy It!!!
customer_reviews.text: This printer seemed like a good deal, but don't buy it!! I will grant you that it looks nice and when it prints, it prints fast. But there was no cable in the box, and I didn't know that, so I had to order the cable seperate. Then for some unknown reason the print jobs hang up, and the only way to clear the queue is to restart your computer. My advice is to spend a little more and get a better printer.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Rinehart

customer_reviews.title: Broken Down Equipment
customer_reviews.text: This printer was completely broken from the gate. The minute I plugged it up it made a very loud noise, so I attempted to use it anyway. Then once I placed the paper in the machine and hit print, it gave me nothing but crumpled up paper jams that never made it out of the machine. Don't recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Ladee CC

customer_reviews.title: Replacement
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an identical one that broke. I plugged it in and it worked immediately. Good price and it arrived on time. Very happy with this order.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Bezverkov

customer_reviews.title: Great value for money and works perfectly well
customer_reviews.text: Great value for money and works perfectly well, while being small. It's just one of the best purchases I've made.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandra

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Printer died with in one week. Other printers never even fired up once.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: printer
customer_reviews.text: I can't tell how it prints, because, for some reason, I can't get my laptop to link properly with it. HELP!
customer_reviews.author: D. K. Farrington

customer_reviews.title: What a great printer for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer for three weeks. It is hooked up directly to my laptop at work.This printer was easy to set up. It prints much quicker and quieter than the Epson C60 I had before, and at a lower price. I've always been very satisfied with HP printers.
customer_reviews.author: Multifaceted Lee

customer_reviews.title: Faulty. Headaches, infuriating sub-standard machine.
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had read reviews before purchasing this POS. But, I've owned maybe 10 HP Printers and figured, it will probably work fine. Wrong. I needed a new printer ASAP, so I liked the price, and purchased. What a headache! This machine cannot figure out how to even print checks! I've been handwriting them to get them out in time. Photos? Ha. Well if you don't mind having to mess around with the paper every single time you print one page. * I will NEVER buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. V

customer_reviews.title: THIS is a cheap piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: They have the best scam in the world going on with this. You have to sign up for a subscription for the printer to work. Then the printer will just log off the internet. Once it does that you cant print any more. It will keep charging you. It is a waste of money regardless of the price. They could be giving it away and you will still be suckered.
customer_reviews.author: Juju D

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I have been able to print five documents. and the the color print cartridge failed, followed by the paper won't feed. Decided to test the scanning mode and that would not work either. Resetting the printer did not work. Hardly a good first impression. I have decided to go back to Canon.
customer_reviews.author: Curt A. Scaglione

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: Every time I print something, it just stalls in a print queue. Then when I reboot the computer, it (usually) prints everything in the queue. About half the time, I have to unplug the printer and replug it in first. So any time you want to print something, you first send it to print, then unplug and replug the printer, then reboot the computer. Apparently this thing wasn't designed to work with Windows 7. If you are using Windows XP or a Mac or something else, maybe you might have better luck.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Worst Printer Ever!~
customer_reviews.text: Well , for the price of this printer, I got maybe four pages out of it, If its worth it. It took ten tries to print a chuck e cheese coupon, Would not print the photos for our Christmas Cards and I was sick with a cold, could not leave house to go to the store to order prints. So my Christmas cards are late thanks to this horrible printer Cant believe they bothered to make a printer that does not work. BTW, it did spit out a poor quality photo a week later ! Yes the stories are true, If you give it a month, it might print something out for you.
customer_reviews.author: BEN

customer_reviews.title: The worst printer I've ever used. Never going cheap HP route again.
customer_reviews.text: Constant errors during printing, stops and starts, need to restart printer and sometimes PC to make it try again, constant paper feeder problems, refuses borderless prints unless you have a color cartridge...like, why?? HP really failed with this one. Ugh.
customer_reviews.author: outlier

customer_reviews.title: Sux.
customer_reviews.text: So frustrating to set up, be prepared with needles to stick in your eyes or a chalkboard to scrape your fingernails across as you try. Save your money give something else a try.
customer_reviews.author: kent k

customer_reviews.title: A total ripoff piece of junk!! DO NOT BUY!!
customer_reviews.text: No exaggeration here. Purchased this printer brand new and had problems from the get go. Would not print 95% of the time, or would only print a portion of the document, and then freeze and do nothing. Kept trouble shooting, calling, reinstalling, checking drivers, etc. Didn't change anything. HP was not able to help either. The warranty is only good for 90 days, so forget calling HP after that because they will not talk to you or help you unless you pay to speak to a service tech. Imagine that. This printer is a lemon. Nothing but problems and HP is no help. COMPLETE JUNK!
customer_reviews.author: Jared B.

customer_reviews.title: LITERALLY THE WORST PRINTER EVER
customer_reviews.text: IS NOT RELIABLE. Only works when it wants to. HORRIBLE HORRIBLE purchase. Save yourself the trouble
customer_reviews.author: M. Tigue

customer_reviews.title: Worst ever
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the worst I have ever used. Threw it in the trash after spending hours trying to get it to connect with HP Easy Start. Bought another brand and had it set up within a few minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Caudill

customer_reviews.title: No Good
customer_reviews.text: This printer is the worst printer I've ever owned. Every time I attempt to print something it turns into an hour (or more) long event of plugging/unplugging the power cord and/or the USB connection. I would strongly recommend looking elsewhere for a printer rather than deal with the misery of this poorly crafted HP product. It has really tainted the HP brand for me and I have moved them down on my list of companies with respectable products...
customer_reviews.author: JAMnBear

customer_reviews.title: Not Good
customer_reviews.text: When it runs it is a great printer. It printed very nice but every few days it would have an error. All the lights would start blinking and it was difficult to get it fixed so I could print again. We use it in a business so that was not acceptable. HP was very good to me. I did the online chat and called in twice. They finally gave me an online giftcard for a new printer. After reading the reviews I selected a different model. We will see how that goes:)
customer_reviews.author: Pool Lady

customer_reviews.title: Always stops working
customer_reviews.text: This printer tends to work for a few days at a time. It will just stop working and you get the useless control center coming up and telling you what you already know, the printer is again not working. The only thing I can find to get it working again is the cycle power on the printer and the computer, and hope it works.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth R. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this piece of crap!
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this printer is so bad it is almost useless. Some documents take over 5 minutes from clicking the "print" button to the beginning of printing. It is frequently necessary to restart my computer to straighten out the messes this printer creates. Envelopes print correctly about 25% of the time. I have a 12 year old HP 895CSE printer that work that works perfectly. I guess HP really figured out how to cut costs!
customer_reviews.author: jeffw

customer_reviews.title: worst ever
customer_reviews.text: this thing is pure junk, every time you install a cartridge, the printer appears boggled unable to communicate with the Pc. it's an utter headache to get it going again this thing isn't worth the cost of the ink it uses, i wouldn't take one for free, it just sits there mystified, that youy want it to preform an action, personally i hate it ALOT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Gregg C. Hickerson

customer_reviews.title: Terrible printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer has not worked well since I bought it. The on/off button caved in and I cannot print out any document without restarting the printer after sending each print job. The software that comes with the printer also provides useless pop-up windows telling you that more ink is needed when it is not. Piece of junk!
customer_reviews.author: Eric Miller

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this printer, unless you want a serious headache! The first HP Deskjet D2660 I purchased had a defective on/off switch. I called HP customer service, and they sent a replacement printer (same new model) which had the SAME defect. I called HP again, they sent another replacement and quess what? It had the SAME FAULTY SWITCH. Three brand new units and they all had the same defect. HP says they cannot refund my purchase price, but they will keep sending me replacements. I've wasted hours on the phone with HP, repackaging the printers and going to the UPS store to return the defective units. If you want a cheap printer that works don't buy the D2660!
customer_reviews.author: Alan Rench

customer_reviews.title: Like it
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer for about 2 weeks now. I had no problems with installation or it's regular printing. The photo quailty printing is not as good as my old HP 3420 printer. When you install this printer you do have to read what it is installing. You do have to choose NOT to install the Yahoo toolbar.
customer_reviews.author: K. Maynard

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Terrible printer. It's been a hassle from day one. Now after a year of limited use, I keep getting "printer head mechanism jammed" messages. It tells me to toggle the power, but even this bogus remedy only works half the time. Absolute junk.
customer_reviews.author: QuAlTu

customer_reviews.title: Awesome printer
customer_reviews.text: Prints very high quality B&W and color. Compact-sized, fat printing, low noise, easy to maintain (removing paper jams is so easy). Combo pack print cartridges are $30 which isnt bad price at all. The HP monitor software is very nice and easy to use as well. I recommend this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Printer
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use, prints fast, no issues. Uses less ink than my Lexmark, and great quality. Eco friendly design, ink available at a decent price, and I love the paper saving features!
customer_reviews.author: N. L. Yarber

customer_reviews.title: Chews paper, guzzles ink.
customer_reviews.text: You'd think HP could make a printer that doesn't jam itself frequently, and one that can print full lines in font sizes below 10. Not this one, at least not the one I've got. The lousy ink consumption I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Burrows

product_meta.title: HP Deskjet D2660 Printer (CH366A#ABA)
product_meta.description: An affordable, easy-to-use printer you can count on for quality documents and web prints. Easily print your documents with the simplicity of only three; one-touch buttons¿power, resume and cancel. The HP Deskjet D2660 printer allows you to save ink, paper and time by quickly stopping unwanted prints with the print-cancel button. Have the new ink ready when you need it thanks to automatic low-ink alerts, and the conveniently located ink cartridges make it fast and easy to replace ink and get back to printing. You can also save ink and paper by combining content from multiple web pages onto one page with HP Smart Web Printing and conserve print supplies by clipping content from multiple websites and printing on a single page. Enjoy quality, worry free printing with Original HP Inks that are designed to work with your HP printer. Thanks to printer software that easily connects with your PC, you can start enjoying your printer right away.
feature_bullets: Print Speed Up to 28 ppm Black and Up to 21 ppm Color
80 Sheet Input Tray and 20 Sheet Output Tray
Three, One Touch Buttons / Power, Resume and Cancel

specifications.Customer Reviews: 2.6 out of 5 stars53 ratings2.6 out of 5 stars
